title: How to Log Out of Facebook on All Devices Using Android

steps.title: Open the Facebook app.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app. This looks like a white f with a blue background. If you aren't already logged into Facebook on your Android, do so now. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This is in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Tap Settings & privacy . You can find this below the app icons.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . A new page will open.

steps.title: Tap Accounts Center.
steps.content: Tap Accounts Center . This is the section at the very top of the screen. A new menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Password and security.
steps.content: Tap Password and security . You can find this under Personal details .

steps.title: Tap Where you're logged in.
steps.content: Tap Where you're logged in . This will be under the Security checks header.

steps.title: Tap your Facebook account.
steps.content: Tap your Facebook account. If you have multiple accounts synced to your Android, you'll see them here.

steps.title: Tap the device you want to log out.
steps.content: Tap the device you want to log out. You can select multiple, or tap Select all .

steps.title: Tap Log out.
steps.content: Tap Log out . This is the blue button at the bottom. You'll be logged out of Facebook on the selected devices. To log out of your current session, tap ☰ and then tap Log out twice. If you don't use your Facebook account, consider deactivating it rather than deleting it .
